cyclone.name: ARLENE
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles W of Ft. Myers Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving south-southeast and expected to continue farther away from the Florida west-central coast, degenerating into a remnant low over the southeast Gulf of Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No landfall forecast – system should remain over the open Gulf and dissipate

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Scattered heavy-rain band impacts possible across the central and southern Florida Peninsula
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (1–3" expected, isolated 6" south of port)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts below tropical-storm force possible; sustained winds expected to remain under 34 kt
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Manatee County coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of rain could deliver 1–3 inches, leading to brief ponding or minor street flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated flash-flood spots on low-lying roads; visibility reductions in squalls
